detailed: Ensure scene safety; tap and shout to check responsiveness.
Call 112 (India) or ask a bystander to call; get an AED if available.
Place heel of one hand on center of chest (lower half of sternum), other hand on top, fingers interlaced.
Keep arms straight; compress 5–6 cm at 100–120 per minute. Allow full chest recoil.
After 30 compressions, give 2 rescue breaths (if trained) — each ~1 second, watch chest rise.
Minimize interruptions; continue cycles of 30:2; switch compressors every 2 minutes if possible.
If an AED arrives, turn it on and follow prompts immediately.
